Source Name: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
Title: Not Wanting to Say Anything about Marcel, Plexigram IV
Dimensions:
each panel: 14 x 20 x 1/8 in. (35.6 x 50.8 x 0.3 cm)
Other (base): 3/4 x 24 x 14 1/2 in. (1.9 x 61 x 36.8 cm)
Description: Two of the eight panels are bronze tinted, six are clear. Printed by Hollander Workshop. Published by Eye Editions, Cincinnati (subsequently Carl Solway Gallery).
Credit Line: Gift of Carl and Elizabeth Solway
Signed: Signature of Cage is incised on the lower right front edge of the base, and the signature of Cage's collaborator Calvin Sumsion also incised on the base.

Source Name: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
Title: Not Wanting to Say Anything about Marcel, Lithograph A
Medium: Color lithograph on black Fabriano rag paper
Description: Hand printed on black Fabriano rag paper using 8 aluminum plates and 9 colors, printed at the Hollander Workshop, NYC. Published by Eye Editions, Cincinnati (subsequently Carl Solway Gallery).
Credit Line: Gift of Carl and Elizabeth Solway
Signed: Signed by Cage in the lower right corner, along with the signature of his collaborator Calvin Sumsion

Source Name: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
Title: Text and glossary related to Not Wanting to Say Anything about Marcel
Description: A text, written by John Cage, describing his process of composition. Based on the I Ching (Chinese "BookofChanges") together with a glossary.
Credit Line: Gift of Carl and Elizabeth Solway
